label: Computer Scientist
Machine Learning Researcher
Tech Enthusiast
basics.summary: Hey there! I am a Computer Science student passionate about building intelligent products. Currently, I am interning at Amazon Robotics as a Software Development Engineer. I am also an incoming MS CS student at Stanford where I'll specialize in Artificial Intelligence. In the past, I have intered at Honeywell as a Software Engineer and conducted reserach with professors as an undergraduate student at Georgia Tech.

work.summary: Incoming MS CS student at Stanford University, concentrating in Artificial Intelligence.
Software Development Engineer (SDE) intern on the Perception and Human Interface (PHI) team. Deferred from Summer 2020 due to COVID-19.
Graduated from Georgia Tech with a BS in CS with threads in Intelligence and Theory.
Collaborated with Prof. Sonia Chernova and Dr. Harish Ravichandar on topics in robot trajectory optimization and knowledge graphs inference.
work.summary1: We leveraged deep learning and path ranking algorithms for building commonsense for robots. I implemented Transformers in PyTorch for commonsense reasoning, outperforming baselines by 11% on search accuracy. This work lead to the submissin of our paper titled "LINK: Learning Instance-Level N-Ary Semantic Knowledge At Scale For Robots Operating in Everyday Environments" to RSS'21.
work.summary2: I also worked on building intelligent robots that adapt behavior to stochastic human motion, thereby allowing safe and comfortable collaboration with humans. I developed pipelines to predict human motion using Gaussian Mixture Models for trajectory optimization in Python, C++, and ROS. This work lead to our paper titled "Anticipatory Human-Robot Collaboration via Multi-Objective Trajectory Optimization" which was published at IROSâ€™20

work.summary: Developed upon Honeywell Connected Plant's backend API to support analysis and visualization of warehouses.
work.summary1: I built a web app in Python using TensorFlow, OpenCV and Scikit-learn to analyze and extract relational data from scanned images.
work.summary2: I also developed upon Honeywell Connected Plant API using Node.js and MongoDB to provide granular insight into warehouse equipment and usage. I wrote production ready code for handling upwards of 3 million requests every month.

work.summary: Collaborated with Prof. Thad Starner on the application of American Sign Language towards creating a game for deaf children.
work.summary1: I built a sign verification system using pose estimation libraries such as MediaPipe and combined them with pattern recognition models such as Hidden Markov Models and Transformers implemented using Python and PyTorch.
work.summary2: We demonstrated that HMMs outperform Transformers for American Sign Language recognition by on average 17% in real-world scenarios. Our results have been published in the paper titled "CopyCat: Using Sign Language Recognition to Help Deaf Children Acquire Language Skills" at CHI'21

work.summary: Entered Georgia Tech as a undergraduate student majoring in CS.

projects.name: CopyCat
projects.description: A game which leverages Sign Language recognition to help deaf children acquire short term memory skills. Uses pose estimation to extract landmarks and models like HMMs and Transformers for recognizing video sequences.

projects.name: Translation
projects.description: In collaboration with Facebook AI, built classifiers for deciding whether translations produced by Transformers are sufficiently good. Uses language models in conjunction with manual feature engineering to train logistic classifiers for the task.

projects.name: LfD
projects.description: Learning agent (Ant-V2) behavior from demonstration using inverse reinforcement learning. We first adapt MixText to identification of trajectories and suboptimal and then integrate it with 2IWIL for learning from demonstrations.

projects.name: SoundSight
projects.description: SoundSight uses computer vision to collect spatial data in the user's immediate vicinity and converts it into 3 dimensional sound allowing complete perception of the environment without the visual senses.

projects.name: SAO
projects.description: Study Alexa Online (SAO) makes collaborative studying easier by turning the Alexa into a tool to connect to the collectively knowledge of other peers. Students connect to study groups via the SAO Alexa skill.

projects.name: Golden Gate
projects.description: Finds news articles covering similar content to provide all perspectives on a topic. We analyze author attitudes using sentiment analysis and find other articles with differing attitudes to provide a comprehesive view.

projects.name: Isomathic
projects.description: Isomathic is a tool for converting handwritten math into LaTex documents. The tool uses OpenCV to extract blocks of text, processes them using Mathpix, and then displays the resulting LaTex file on the website.
